timeline.bodyText:
One or both of these functions should to be renamed as :

filterUnknownCauRoles : is filtering OUT unknown CaseRoles: i.e. returns a list EXCLUDING the unknown
filterExistingCauRoles: is filtering ON existing CaseRoles: i.e. returns a list containing ONLY pre-existing CaseRoles
timeline.author: mattnayler
timeline.path: src/main/java/uk/gov/hmcts/ccd/domain/service/caseaccess/CaseAccessOperation.java

timeline.path: src/aat/resources/features/F-111 - Remove Case-Assigned Users and Roles/With Organisation Context/common/S-111.13/S-111.13_Repeat_Call_to_Remove_For_Hemanth.td.json
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,32 @@
+{
+  "_guid_": "S-111.13_Repeat_Call_to_Remove_For_Hemanth",
+  "_extends_": "F-111_Remove_Case_Assigned_User_Roles_Base",
+
+  "specs": [
+    "to repeat the same request as above this time with a different user, Hemanth"
+  ],
+
+  "users": {
+    "_extends_": "F-111_Users"
+  },
+
+  "request": {
+    "headers": {
+      "Authorization": "Bearer ${[scenarioContext][testData][users][userDil][accessToken]}"
+    },
+    "body": {
+      "case_users": [
+        {
+          "case_id": "${[scenarioContext][siblingContexts][F-111_Prerequisite_Case_Creation_Call_for_Case_Assignment][testData][actualResponse][body][id]}",
+          "user_id": "${[scenarioContext][testData][users][userHemanth][id]}",
+          "case_role": "[CR-1]",
+          "organisation_id": "${[scenarioContext][siblingContexts][S-111.13_Add_Case_Assigned_User_Roles_for_Case_C1_With_Organisation][childContexts][F-111_Prerequisite_Counter_Check_Call][childContexts][F-111_Get_Organisation_Identifier_Dil][testData][actualResponse][body][organisationIdentifier]}"

timeline.bodyText: Should this be a reference to F-111_Get_Organisation_Identifier_Olawale rather than Dil? IGNORE: it is strange that AC refers only to Dil's organisation without reference to checking Hemanth and Olawale are in same org.

timeline.path: src/aat/resources/features/F-111 - Remove Case-Assigned Users and Roles/With Organisation Context/common/S-111.13/S-111.13.td.json
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,38 @@
+{
+  "title": "Must successfully decrease Assigned User Count when removing a user and case role for a specific case",
+
+  "_guid_": "S-111.13",
+  "_extends_": "F-111_Remove_Case_Assigned_User_Roles_Base",
+
+  "specs": [
+    "Richard - who can create a case",
+    "Dil - who is to add and remove some case role assignment for a case",
+    "Olawale - with an active solicitor profile",
+    "Hemanth - with an active solicitor profile",
+    "is made from an authorised application, by Dil, with the Case ID of C1, User ID of Olawale, proper Case Role CR-1 and the Organisation ID of Olawale"
+  ],
+
+  "users": {
+    "_extends_": "F-111_Users"
+  },
+
+  "request": {
+    "headers": {
+      "Authorization": "Bearer ${[scenarioContext][testData][users][userDil][accessToken]}"
+    },
+    "body": {
+      "case_users": [
+        {
+          "case_id": "${[scenarioContext][childContexts][F-111_Prerequisite_Case_Creation_Call_for_Case_Assignment][testData][actualResponse][body][id]}",
+          "user_id": "${[scenarioContext][testData][users][userOlawale][id]}",
+          "case_role": "[CR-1]",
+          "organisation_id": "${[scenarioContext][childContexts][S-111.13_Add_Case_Assigned_User_Roles_for_Case_C1_With_Organisation][childContexts][F-111_Prerequisite_Counter_Check_Call][childContexts][F-111_Get_Organisation_Identifier_Dil][testData][actualResponse][body][organisationIdentifier]}"

replies.bodyText: Yes, I'm aware of this. Since Dil has n't registered in the AAT PRD - so I changed to use becky user for the time being.

replies.bodyText: @MSancaktutar  could you register user Dil into AAT PRD system please (befta.caseworker.2.solicitor.2@gmail.com)
replies.author: smathangi

replies.bodyText:
do you mean putting the user in our test organisation? @smathangi .
Do you really need that? We already have enough users in our solicitor company on AAT, no?

replies.bodyText: Changed to Dil in commit f9115e7

replies.bodyText: yes, but F-111 scenarios are talking about user Dil organisation. (or if you're happy with above hack )

replies.bodyText: @smathangi Looks like we may need to update user Dil reference in F-111_User_Dil.td.json to a different user:  is emma suitable as per F-002 - Get Assignments in My Organisation/Prerequisite_Case_Assignment_C3_Emma.td.json?
replies.author: mattnayler

replies.bodyText:
@MSancaktutar  looks like Emma doesn't have relevant roles that match with case jurisdiction BEFTA_JURISDICTION_2. So, she can't access case created in  BEFTA_JURISDICTION_2.  What do you suggest ?
Would you like to keep user as befta.caseworker.2.solicitor.2@gmail.com for Dil and register same user in PRD? or assign BEFTA_JURISDICTION_2 roles to Emma or any other alternatives..?
replies.author: smathangi

replies.bodyText: @smathangi - Please give me the role Emma needs. Is it only and exactly caseworker-befta_jurisdiction_2? I'll straight add it to Emma.
replies.author: MSancaktutar

replies.bodyText: caseworker,caseworker-befta_jurisdiction_2,caseworker-befta_jurisdiction_2-solicitor
replies.author: smathangi

replies.bodyText: @smathangi  - Emma's roles have been added.
replies.author: MSancaktutar

timeline.bodyText: Most/All references in Scenarios's are for Dil: even when roles are being added/removed for other users.  This feels wrong: but it is how most of the ACs are defined.  It may be worth adding an expectedResponse check to two of the three prerequisite files to check all user's are in same org: therefore ensuring the the use of Dil's organisation everywhere is justified: otherwise we may as well have hardcoded a fake Org ID.
